* Ett intresse för att lära dig nya teknologier och en vilja att utvecklas inom ditt yrkesområde.


**Din tekniska verktygslåda kan med fördel innehålla:**
* Systemadministration: Windows Server, Linux (Ubuntu, CentOS, RedHat), PowerShell/Bash, VMware/Hyper-V, backup-lösningar (Veeam), nätverkskunskap.
* Nätverkskunskap: Cisco, Juniper, Fortinet, VPN-tekniker, felsökning och nätverksövervakning (Wireshark, Zabbix).
* Databasadministration: SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL, säkerhet, prestandaoptimering och hög tillgänglighet.


 Men det viktigaste är att du är en problemlösare som trivs med att agera snabbt, hålla ett lugn under press och alltid vara redo att ta dig an nya utmaningar. Du är en lagspelare som kommunicerar tydligt och samarbetar för att nå gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Visst låter det spännande?
   

  

 Vi vill gärna höra mer om dig och vad du brinner för inom IT-drift. Skicka in din intresseanmälan idag – kanske är det just dig vi ringer när nästa spännande uppdrag kommer in.
   

  

 Vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: Software Engineers to Zalando
description:
**About The Company And The Role**
 We are looking for two Software Engineers to join Zalando, an international e-commerce company that is shaping the future of retail. This company provides a platform that serves millions of customers worldwide and is now expanding its engineering team to continue delivering innovative solutions. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with technologies such as Java, Kotlin, AWS, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch, all while collaborating with passionate teams focused on driving innovation.
   

  

 In the role of Software Engineer, you’ll develop and operate large-scale systems that ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment. Your primary focus will be to build backend applications that handle high volumes of data and deliver seamless experiences for customers and partners.
   

  

 At Zalando, you’ll be part of a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. This role offers you the chance to contribute to an innovative, customer-centric organization that is reshaping the future of online retail.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing and maintaining high-performance, low-latency systems for data streaming and processing.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and scale solutions for fulfillment and customer experience.
* Taking ownership of applications, managing them from development through deployment and monitoring.
* Innovating and finding solutions to scale the platform in an increasingly complex ecosystem.
* Actively contributing to the development of new features and improvements.


 You’ll contribute to Zalando’s success by ensuring the systems you build directly enhance the customer experience. As a Software Engineer, you’ll be challenged by the complexity of building distributed systems at scale and will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and countries.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* A relevant degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* 3-6 years of professional experience in software engineering.
* Solid experience with Java or Kotlin and building APIs.
* Familiarity with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and event-driven architectures.
* Some experience or interest in AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch.
* A passion for problem-solving and building scalable solutions.
* Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Kubernetes) and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of Kafka or similar messaging systems.
* Experience working with large-scale, high-availability systems.


 We are looking for candidates who are proactive, innovative, and motivated to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Scope: Full-time position (100%)
   

  

 Location: Stockholm.
   

  

 Selection process: We apply continuous selection, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter Ronja Bergman on ronja.bergman@techtalents.se
   

  

 Does this sound like the position for you? We look forward to hearing from you – warmly welcome with your application!
   

  

 In this recruitment, Zalando is collaborating with Tech Talents, and we direct applications to Tech Talents.

title: Hardware Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the inventor of the
 
 YubiKey
 
 ––the world's first and leading security key. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and recently went public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:**

 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our
 

 Life at Yubico Page
 

 on LinkedIn and our awards
 

 here
 
**.**




  






 The Role:
 




  






 Yubico is looking for a Hardware Engineer who is innovative and passionate about the hardware and firmware design of cutting-edge security devices as well as related production equipment and testers. In this role, you will be part of the team that takes new ideas from prototypes to mass-producible hardware. As a Hardware Engineer, you will also be responsible for analyzing hardware designs for manufacturability, security, and reliability. Key success criteria for the role include the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, attention to detail, and a commitment to the highest standards.
 





  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* **Design and develop** 
 secure embedded hardware for security devices
* **Create and optimize** 
 PCB layouts using EDA tools (OrCAD, Altium)
* **Perform hardware debugging** 
 using JTAG, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers
* **Develop and execute** 
 in-circuit and functional tests to validate hardware reliability
* **Ensure manufacturability (DFM) and production readiness** 
 , collaborating with suppliers and contract manufacturers
* **Implement security best practices** 
 (TPM, UEFI, Secure Boot, TrustZone) in hardware design
* **Work cross-functionally** 
 with software, mechanical, and production teams to develop integrated solutions
* **Document hardware designs, test procedures, and security protocols** 
 for internal and external use
* **Communicate technical concepts clearly** 
 to stakeholders, including the company owner
* **Take ownership of projects** 
 , demonstrating resourcefulness and a self-driven approach to problem-solving



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Bachelor’s or Master’s in Electrical Engineering or a relevant technical discipline (or equivalent experience)
* 3+ years of experience in Electrical Engineering
* Experience designing embedded hardware systems using EDA/PCB design software (e.g., OrCAD, Altium)
* Familiarity with bus communication protocols (USB, I2C, SPI, UART, PCIe, RS232/RS485)
* Ability to design for manufacturability and guide assembly through various stages
* Experience with microcontrollers (preferably STM, TI, Freescale, NXP) and relevant software stacks, as well as bare-metal programming
* Proficiency in hardware debugging and use of relevant tools such as JTAG, multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers
* Knowledge of x86 and/or ARM chipset and firmware security (e.g., TPM, UEFI, TrustZone, secure boot)



  




**Optional Skills:** 
* MCAD (SolidWorks)
* ECAD (Layout & Routing)
* Robotics/Automation
* In Circuit Testing and Functional Testing






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.**

title: Senior Service Desk Agent
description:
Till ett uppdrag hos en kund i Stockholm söker vi en tekniker med stort driv som vill vara med och påverka vår kunds fortsatta tillväxt med ett kreativt och positivt arbetsklimat.
   

  

 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag men tanken är att anställningen senare ska gå över till kunden.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Du kommer att arbeta som Senior Service desk Agent inom IT-support och drift. Kunden har en bred IT-miljö med höga säkerhetskrav på system och funktioner. Servicedesken hanterar både 1:st och 2:nd line ärenden på en mycket bred nivå - allt från lösenordsbyte, hård -och mjukvarusupport, klientsupport och applikationssupport till felsökning och administration av servrar, koordinering och kontakt med 3:e parts leverantörer. Rollen ställer höga krav på service och kundbemötande.
   

  

 Utöver en mycket trevlig arbetsplats med högt i tak och konstruktiva dialoger finns stora möjligheter att visa framfötter och växa i sin roll. Du kommer att arbeta proaktivt för att skapa hög tillgänglighet och förbättra kundens IT-miljö.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi söker dig med minst 5 års erfarenhet inom liknande arbetsuppgifter. Din förmåga att arbeta affärsmässigt och bygga relationer är oerhört viktig. Du finner glädje i att ge råd och stöd och därmed kan bidra till utveckling. Att du brinner för service och "det lilla extra" samt att du alltid har kunden i fokus är ett måste.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Mycket god administrativ kunskap om AD, Azure AD, MS365, ärendehanteringsprocess, dokumentation/uppföljning
* Relevant erfarenhet på minst 5 år och trivs i rollen som en servicedeskmedarbetare
* Mycket goda kunskaper gällande server, nätverk, klient och molnlösningar
* Självgående
* God förmåga att finna vägar till rätt lösning
* God analytisk förmåga och kvalitetsmedveten
* Ha lätt för att lära dig nya saker och processer relaterade till IT och tjänsten
* Kunna flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Har du erfarenhet inom nätverk och infrastruktur och är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Hos Amendo Tech får du möjligheten att arbeta med ledande företag inom bank, finans, retail, myndigheter, produktbolag och innovativa startups. Vi söker just nu engagerade konsulter för kommande interimsuppdrag som kan stärka våra kunders tekniska landskap och säkerställa deras infrastruktur och nätverk på högsta nivå.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kunnig inom nätverksarkitektur och säkerhet och som har erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och övervaka nätverkslösningar i komplexa miljöer. Du har arbetat med några av följande tekniker:
   

  

* Nätverksprotokoll och teknik: Stark kompetens inom TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLAN, VPN och routingprotokoll (t.ex. OSPF, BGP).
* Brandväggar och säkerhet: Erfarenhet av brandväggar, IDS/IPS, och andra säkerhetslösningar, exempelvis Cisco ASA, Palo Alto eller Fortinet.
* Trådlösa nätverk: Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och hantera trådlösa nätverk (WLAN) och Wi-Fi-lösningar.
* Lastbalansering och redundans: Kunskap om lastbalanserare och failover-lösningar för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet.
* Nätverksövervakning och felsökning: Vana vid att använda övervakningsverktyg.
* Certifieringar: Gärna certifieringar inom Cisco (t.ex. CCNA, CCNP) eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Molnplattformar: Gedigen erfarenhet av AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud Platform samt arbete med hybridmoln-arkitektur.
* Virtuella miljöer: Erfarenhet av virtualiseringsteknologier som VMware, Hyper-V eller KVM.
* Serveradministration: Kompetens inom Windows- och Linux-servrar, inklusive säkerhetspatchning och hantering av Active Directory.
* Lagring och backup: Kunskap om SAN, NAS och backuplösningar som Veeam eller Commvault.
* Automatisering och scripting: Förmåga att effektivisera och automatisera arbetsflöden med hjälp av PowerShell, Python eller Ansible.
* Säkerhet och övervakning: Förståelse för säkerhetspraxis och vana vid övervakningsverktyg för driftssäkerhet, exempelvis Zabbix eller Splunk.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Sales Associate
description:
**Job Description**
 Core Responsibilities
   

  

  

  
* Tasks are be assigned by floor leader in duty
* Merchandise receiving and stocking
* Driving sales
* Ensure a signature experience for every guest that visits our LEGO stores by greeting every guest in your location, performing all cash register functions and portraying a professional, gracious, friendly and engaging manner at all times
* Provide a clean, safe and visually stimulating environment by performing daily cleaning duties, maintaining store displays and learning and executing LEGO Brand Retail visual standards
* Safely and efficiently operate the store stockroom as you assist in the receiving of merchandise, maintain the stockroom to LBR standards, know and abide by all safety regulations and notify management of potential shortage situations
* Typically responsible for store operational tasks in duty


 Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
 Here is what you can expect
   

  

**Family Care Leave** 
 - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
   

  

**Insurances** 
 – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
   

  

**Wellbeing** 
 - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.
   

  

**Colleague Discount** 
 – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
   

  

**Bonus** 
 - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.
   

  

**Workplace** 
 - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.
   

  

 Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.
   

  

 The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.
   

  

 The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.
   

  

 Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
   

  

 Just imagine building your dream career.
   

  

 Then make it real.
   

  

**Join the LEGO® team today.**

title: OT Security Engineer - Offshore Wind
company: Institute of Marine Engineering, Science & Technology (IMarEST)
description:
**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people's homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for an OT security Engineer who wants to work more in the line of adviser and compliance within the field of OT security. The OT Security Engineer is responsible for overseeing activities to establish secure OT environment. He/she collaborates with cybersecurity teams, system owners, operational personnel to implement secure system architectures, mitigates cyber threats and vulnerabilities and conducts routine reviews of OT systems related to security standards and regulations. Additionally, he/she maintains security documentation, procedures support to setup relevant security controls. He/she is familiar with modern security technologies such as firewall, log management (SIEM), IDS, endpoint protection, access control systems, and other related security technologies within the OT environment. Ideally familiar with security frameworks such as IEC62443, ISO 27001 or similar.
   

  

**Manage Quality And Continuous Improvement Of OT Security Architecture**
* Perform testing and assessment of new cybersecurity technologies and controls
* Recommend security products, services and procedures to improve OT system architecture designs
* Provide inputs to OT security product roadmaps


**Support and sparring partner in developing OT security architecture / Support the OT security system integration:**
* Collaborate with architects to shape security controls, systems, remote access and architecture for the organisation's OT infrastructure according to specified requirements
* Implement IT/OT controls to safeguard the OT environment
* Through guidance and control, to ensure our IT/OT setup follow our zoning model (based on the Purdue Model)


**Support and enable our OT teams to improve and maintain cybersecurity posture of OT systems:**
* Collaborate with cybersecurity and operational teams to implement vulnerability mitigations, patches, or compensating controls on OT systems.
* Identify potential risks (operational, safety, business etc.).
* Through guidance and a set of controls, ensure the OT operations are compliant with our policies and standard.


**Respond to OT security incidents:**
* Provide inputs to support the fulfilment of incident response processes
* Partner with other stakeholders to shape mitigation strategies for cybersecurity threats


**Location**
 Kolding, Amsterdam, Hamburg, London, Stockholm and Katowice.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 As a key member of our cybersecurity team, you'll bring a robust blend of technical expertise and soft skills to help us safeguard our digital and operational environments. Your role will span across a wide range of responsibilities, from verifying controls, to overseeing asset inventories and supporting the incident response.
   

  

 You'll play a vital role in our cyber incident response efforts, ensuring swift and effective management of threats. Your deep understanding of communication networks and security-combined with your ability to design and maintain segmented, resilient infrastructures-will be essential in protecting both IT and OT environments.
   

  

 You'll lead initiatives in security governance, risk assessment, and vulnerability management. You'll evaluate OT products and solutions for security compliance, contribute to the design of secure architectures, and help us maintain a strong cybersecurity posture across our supply chain.
   

  

 Your knowledge of international standards such as ISO27001 and IEC62443, along with familiarity with regulations like KRITIS 2.0, NIS2, and the Swedish Protective Act, will ensure our practices remain compliant and forward-thinking. Holding certifications such as CISSP, GICSP, IEC62443 Cybersecurity Expert, or Security+, as well as network credentials like CCNA or CCNP, will further demonstrate your commitment to excellence.
   

  

 Beyond technical skills, we value your ability to communicate clearly, think critically, and solve problems creatively. You'll thrive in a collaborative environment where teamwork, inclusivity, and transdisciplinary thinking are key. Your sense-making abilities and computational thinking will help you navigate complexity, while your innovative mindset will drive continuous improvement.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
**We welcome your application in English, no later than, August 10th 2025. Due to summer holidays we take a longer application period and won't start screening and inviting candidates till the week of August 11th** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website and that you refrain from submitting a cover letter with your application. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter anne.vriesema@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Social Media Manager (Consultant)
description:
Seeking a junior Social Media Manager (Consultant) for ModuKey – Modular Keyboard Project
   


 We’re launching
 **ModuKey** 
 , a sleek and customizable modular keyboard aimed at creators, professionals, and tech enthusiasts. To support our go-to-market and build buzz pre- and post-launch, we're looking for a creative and self-driven
 **Social Media Manager** 
 to join us on a
 **6-month consulting project** 
 (approx. 8 hrs/week).
 



  




 Your Role
 
 You’ll own and grow the ModuKey brand presence primarily on
 **Instagram** 
 and
 **YouTube** 
 . This includes:
 


* **Developing and executing content ideas** 
 that resonate with mechanical keyboard lovers and the DIY tech crowd
* Planning and posting regular short-form and long-form content (reels, carousels, video snippets, build tutorials, etc.)
* Sparking and participating in conversation in relevant communities
* Experimenting with formats and styles — you’ll have a lot of creative freedom
* Tracking basic engagement metrics and iterating on what works


 About You
 * You know your way around
 **Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts** 
 . You understand algorithm behavior, trending formats, and how to hook an audience quickly.
* You're
 **early in your career or a talented junior** 
 , possibly freelancing or building a creative portfolio
* You
 **thrive in autonomous environments** 
 . You don’t need a script — just a north star and the space to explore.
* You enjoy modular hardware, design, or the keyboard space (bonus if you’re already active in mech keyboard or maker communities)


 The Gig
 * **Scope** 
 : ~8 hours/week
* **Duration** 
 : Initial 6-month contract, with possibility for extension
* **Type** 
 : Consultant / Freelancer only
* **Location** 
 : Stockholm and Malmö (Åkarp). Remote friendly but it would be good for the content with trips to Malmö from time to time.

title: Sektionschef IT för kraftsystemdrift
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med den senaste tekniken ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I samband med en organisationsutveckling inom avdelningen IT för Kraftsystem och Elmarknad inom division IT, där nya sektionsindelningar införs, söker vi nu en sektionschef för IT för kraftsystemdrift. Rollen är nyinrättad och erbjuder dig en unik möjlighet att leda och utveckla sektionen. Du kommer att bidra i avdelningens vidare implementering av den nya organisationen som innebär att utveckla och effektivisera arbetssätt för att möta verksamhetens i de snabba förändringar som sker.
   

  

 Som sektionschef har du personal- verksamhets- och ekonomiskt ansvar för sektionens mål och leveranser. Du har personalansvar för sektionens enhetschefer samt roller som finns i sektionens gemensamma funktion. Du rapporterar till avdelningschef IT för Kraftsystem och Elmarknad och stöttar även denne i t.ex. verksgemensamma frågeställningar och utveckling. Som sektionschef kommer du att
   

  

* Leda sektionens tre enheter med enhetschefer
* Inneha viktig roll i sektionens leveranser både utveckling som förvaltning
* Delta i styrgrupps- och ledningsgruppsarbete
* Styra, leda och arbeta med verksamhetsutveckling för sektionen och uppdrag
* Stötta avdelningschef och bidra i att nå avdelningens strategiska riktning och mål
* Stötta och utveckla underställda chefer i deras roller


 Avdelningen har det övergripande strategiska och operativa leveransansvaret av de IT-lösningar som möjliggör att Svenska kraftnät kan leverera enligt uppdraget inom systemansvaret. Till det hör allt från styrning, övervakning och balansering av kraftsystemet till att göra analyser på kort och lång sikt samt säkerställa en fungerande elmarknad.
   

  

 Sektionen har det strategiska och operativa leveransansvaret av de IT-lösningar som möjliggör drift och planering av kraftsystemet.
   

  

 Uppdraget är att möta verksamhetens behov över tid genom att kunna erbjuda moderna IT-lösningar som möjliggör att verksamheten når sina mål, både i det operativa och strategiska, för att kunna upprätthålla systemansvaret med balansering av transmissionsnätet.
   

  

 Genom den pågående energiomställningen där Svenska kraftnät, och IT, har en viktig roll finns stora möjligheter till löpande utveckling. Det är en central roll i att leverera kritiska IT-lösningar till vår kärnverksamhet och uppdrag där framtidens stamnät kräver nya och adaptiva IT-lösningar utifrån kraftsystemets förändring.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav**
 För denna roll söker vi dig som har ett driv att nå resultat i samarbete med chefer, medarbetare och andra intressenter i och utanför organisationen. Det är mycket som händer i den utvecklingsfas som Svenska kraftnät just nu befinner sig vilket gör du behöver vara en person som är stabil och bra på att skapa hållbara strukturer i ditt arbetssätt. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Du har en relevant akademisk examen såsom ingenjör, data-/informationsvetenskap eller systemutveckling alternativt motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Du har även erfarenhet
   

  

* Att under flera år lett genom andra ledare, exempelvis som chef över chefer på mellannivå eller högre, med ansvar för både personal, resultat och budget.
* Av strategiskt arbete inom såväl verksamhetsutveckling och förändringsledning
* Av att arbeta med internationella leverantörer utifrån styrning, hantering av IT-avtal och uppföljning av leveranser och samarbete med externa parter


 Du har också mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vi ser det som
 **meriterande** 
 om du har erfarenhet av
   

  

* IT-system med stor komplexitet och utvecklingstakt i kombination med höga tillgänglighets- och säkerhetskrav
* Att ha arbetat med säkerhetskänslig verksamhet
* Nordisk/Europeiskt samarbete - t.ex. inom energifrågor
* IT-lösningar inom energi- eller elkraftsbranschen
* Arbete i chefsroll inom offentlig verksamhet


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 % .
* Resor kan förekomma några gånger per år, främst inom Norden.
* Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-13. Du kommer att få svara på ett antal frågor istället för ett personligt brev och behöver bara bifoga ditt CV.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.
* I denna rekryteringsprocess tillämpas tester.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


**Vid frågor, kontakta gärna**
* Cumhur Sel, rekryterande chef, 010 475 82 14
* Victoria Waltenberg, rekryterare, 010 350 90 45
* Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72
* Erica Midfjäll, ST, 010 475 87 31


- 

 Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se. Under sommaren kan vi ha längre svarstider med anledning av semestertider.
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
Aras is unique in the PLM industry worldwide. With our business model and innovative platform, we are changing and revolutionizing an entire industry. Our advanced technology provides greater scalability, flexibility and security for the largest organizations worldwide. Airbus, Audi, Denso, General Motors (GM), Honda, Kawasaki Microsoft, Mitsubishi and Nissan, among others, are already using our software.
   

  

 Are you an experienced Project Manager able to lead PLM implementation projects for some of the largest manufacturing companies in the world?
   

  

 Then you might be our new Senior Project Manager.
   

  

 Your Responsibilities
   

  

 As a Senior Project Manager at Aras, you have the overall responsibility for the overall success of all assigned projects. The key objectives are to manage all projects according to the statement of work delivering on time, within scope and budget.
   

  

**You Will**
* Manage multiple projects according to the statement of work
* Perform the overall day-to-day Project Management to ensure that deliverables are achieved within time/cost/quality constraints
* Lead all project communication, gate reviews, risk management, and open issue activities.
* Provide project metrics to internal and external stakeholders
* Prepare project status reports and keep the Team, Management, Clients and others informed of project status and related issues and escalations
* Lead meetings with project team and client personnel (including client executives) on business or technical level discussions. Ability to drive towards consensus within the group
* Supervise and manage project teams that may be located either onsite or offshore
* Organize project teams ensuring that the project is adequately resourced and has the appropriate skills, competencies, and capacity
* Identify and manage change requests by documenting the change and getting customer approval.
* Analyze and manage project risks in collaboration with the project team to inform stakeholders on project status by creating necessary reports
* Manage budget in accordance with the project pricing model including managing the project purchase orders ensuring that these are received and processed in accordance with internal procedure
* Establish and maintain activity planning for use internally and externally taking into account effects that can affect realization of activities and milestones
* Control time management of projects by managing hours or deliverables by employees within our delivery system and ensuring that it matches the contract with the customer


 Your profile
   

  

 We expect that you have experience project managing the implementation of information systems within the engineering/manufacturing industry. You are able to professionally interact and communicate with customers and internal team members.
   

  

**In Addition, You Have**
* Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
* The ability to work and successfully interact with client executives and management staff members
* Proven strong project management skills with accountability for end-to-end delivery
* Strong rapport and relationship building skills with both internal individuals and external customers. Must be an effective communicator in difficult customer situations
* Excellent written communication skills to create Statements of Work, specifications, project plans, and other project documentation
* Clearly demonstrated the ability to work with minimal supervision
* A thorough understanding of large-scale enterprise application deployment methodologies with experience leading teams in an Agile / Scrum environment
* Proven with deployment experience with enterprise software implementations in a Project Manager role, preferably within PLM
* Strong planning, problem solving, and decision-making skills
* A highly organized and self-motivated drive with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
* The ability to create work breakdown structures, assist in estimation, validate estimate confidence, and develop a schedule
* The ability to manage multiple projects concurrently
* The ability to work with all levels of the organization (Development, Sales, Marketing, Operations, and within the Professional Services Group) in a fast-paced environment
* The ability to identify active project risks, monitors for risk triggers, and executes contingency plan
* Fluent in English and Swedish for communication in an international environment
* Swedish citizenship is required
* Willingness to travel


 As you will be working in a mostly remote working organization, it is important that you are able to work independently but at the same time have a strong team spirit.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* Dynamic, open-minded & international team
* Development opportunities in a high growth environment
* Work remotely or in one of our modern offices
* Flexible working time models
* Extensive Onboarding
* Great team spirit and warm, inclusive work environment.

title: Regional Vice President, Nordics
description:
****Your work days are brighter here.****
 At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
   

  

 At Workday, we value our candidates’ privacy and data security. Workday will never ask candidates to apply to jobs through websites that are not Workday Careers.
   

  

 Please be aware of sites that may ask for you to input your data in connection with a job posting that appears to be from Workday but is not.
   

  

 In addition, Workday will never ask candidates to pay a recruiting fee, or pay for consulting or coaching services, in order to apply for a job at Workday.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Workday is looking for a Regional Vice President, Nordics to lead and grow a world-class team of Regional Sales Directors and Account Executives selling next generation Enterprise Cloud Applications.
   

  

 As the leader of a critical sector that directly impacts the overall company goal, he/she will have the growth potential to take on larger responsibilities as Workday looks to double in size and beyond in the coming years.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The ideal candidate will have built and led high performing sales teams across our growth markets, across industry verticals and across a broad Enterprise Cloud portfolio, with a strong track record of driving innovation, scalability and disruptive thinking. This person needs to be an expert at positioning business value, selling enterprise software solutions, managing complex sales cycles and building relationships with key stakeholders.
   

  

* Guide and manage the activities of the their assigned sector to ensure that company revenue goals and objectives are exceeded
* Develop and execute on a business plan to expand the Workday footprint
* Managing daily and weekly activities, pipelines, forecasts and closed deals to ensure above quota results based on successful pipeline management
* Attracting, hiring, on-boarding and retaining top sales talent
* Display a thorough understanding of business needs and revenue potential for accounts in the assigned region
* Work with team members individually as needed while always promoting a healthy team environment
* Supporting the sales team in their sales meetings with prospects
* Leveraging metrics to measure results
* Demonstrating the value placed on continued training and education through the enforcement of the Workday Way
* Function as a change agent, demonstrating his/her ability to uphold the standards consistent with a strong pipeline management system that leverages its own relevant performance data
* Function in a strategic capacity while enforcing tactical team performance issues
* Building a results-driven culture of accountability and transparency
* Maintaining an external focus, championing shareholder interests and focusing on customers in decision-making
* Serving as a visionary, articulating a compelling, long-term vision for the future, inspiring others to action
* Demonstrating strategic thought leadership, engaging in reengineering to redeploy invested capital to higher value opportunities
* Exemplifying logic in making decisions based on relevant facts and data, not assumptions and hope


**About You**
 The Regional Vice President, Nordics will be a seasoned executive with tremendous drive, intelligence and capability. She/he will be highly motivated and have the ability and desire to have an impact on the future of the business. The successful candidate will be a multi-dimensional thinker who operates not only on the basis of important past experiences, but in light of new approaches and developments that occur in the market.
   

  

 Additional personal and professional attributes include:
   

  

* Minimum of 10+ years enterprise software sales experience successfully selling solutions at the C-level with 4+ years of sales management experience. 2nd line sales management experience is a plus.
* Experience managing and building a team of successful SaaS and/or Cloud sales professionals and ability to train RSDs and AEs
* Proven leadership ability to influence, develop and empower employees to achieve objectives with a team approach
* Strong track record of exceeding company sales quotas and forecasts in a complex sales environment
* Experience in territory management and planning, at the regional and account levels
* Proven expertise with teaching, coaching and training sales methodologies
* Strong written, verbal, presentation and organizational skills required
* Willing to travel as needed


**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 ,

title: Senior mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
**Är du redo att ta nästa steg och arbeta med banbrytande utveckling av inbyggd programvara? Vill du vara en del av ett härligt team där din expertis kan skapa verklig förändring och utveckling hos våra kunder? Häng med oss på Together Tech i Stockholm och bidra till utvecklingen av hållbara, högkvalitativa inbyggda system!**
**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Designa, utveckla och underhålla inbyggda programvarulösningar för produkter hos kunder som kräver hög kvalitet och tillförlitlighet.
* Arbeta genom hela produktutvecklingens livscykel, från koncept till design, testning och implementering.
* Skriva effektiv, strukturerad och väldokumenterad kod i C eller C++ för inbyggda Linux-plattformar.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för sömlösa projektleveranser.
* Engagera dig i felsökning, verifiering och validering av inbyggda system
* Bidra till en kultur av kunskapsdelning, innovation och lagarbete


**Din tekniska bakgrund**
* Master- eller kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, IT, mjukvara eller motsvarande
* Professionell erfarenhet av att utveckla programvara för inbyggda system i C++, Python eller C#, i Linux-baserade plattformar.
* Djup förståelse för inbyggd mjukvara och interaktion mellan mjukvara och hårdvarukomponenter.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt


 En del av våra uppdrag finns inom säkerhetsklassade områden och för dessa krävs en säkerhetsprövning som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Svenskt medborgarskap är krav i säkerhetsklassade uppdrag.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
* Nyfiken, anpassningsbar och öppen för att lära dig nya tekniker och metoder.
* Proaktiv, självgående och kan arbeta självständigt såväl som i team.
* Stark relationsbyggande förmåga med kollegor, kunder och partners.
* Konsultativt tankesätt med ett engagemang för att leverera hållbara lösningar av hög kvalitet.


**Together Tech - Hållbar produktutveckling**
 På Together Tech kommer du att vara en del av en samarbetsinriktad och tillväxtorienterad miljö där ingenjörer brinner för att använda teknik för varaktiga, hållbara lösningar. Vi erbjuder möjligheter till professionell utveckling genom varierande uppdrag och innovativa projekt.
   

  

**Vi stödjer din professionella och personliga utveckling med:**
* Trygg anställning, fast lön och konkurrenskraftiga förmåner och kollektivavtal.
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kronor per år, hälsokontroller och bidrag till friskvårdsaktiviteter.
* Ett brett utbud av sociala aktiviteter – från enklare afterworks till större events tex. konferenser.
* Individuella utvecklingsplaner och kontinuerlig utbildning
* Möjlighet att arbeta med andra ledande ingenjörer i teknikuppdrag på hög nivå.


 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen 2024 och 2025.
   

  

 Är du redo att driva innovation inom inbyggda system på Together Tech? Ansök idag!
   

  

 Upplysningar om anställningen lämnas av, vänligen kontakta Anna Öfwerman på +46790738026

title: FAST Development Program-Field Applications Engineer - Stockholm, Sverige
description:
**Job Description**
**Change the world. Love your job.**
 When you join TI, you will participate in the Career Accelerator Program (CAP), which provides professional and technical training and resources to accelerate your ramp into TI and set you up for long-term career success. Within this program, we also offer function-specific technical training and on-the-job learning opportunities that will encourage you to solve problems through a variety of hands-on, meaningful experiences from your very first day on the job.
   

  

 TI's FAST (Field Applications & Sales Training) Program is designed to prepare Sales & Applications team members for customer-oriented careers that pair technical skills with business perspectives. The program provides experiences that help rising TIers understand how to successfully grow TI's business and to thrive throughout their entire TI career. There are two available FAST program tracks: (1) Field Applications and (2) Technical Sales.
   

  

 This 11-month Experience Aims To Establish Rising Field Applications Engineers (FAEs) As Technical TI Experts With Customer Engineers And Internal Teams. The Track Includes Two 6-month Rotations\*
   

  

 Rotation 1, Field Sales Office (FSO): The FSO rotation is centered on learning how to work directly with customers to solve technical challenges, and to ultimately maximize TI's revenue by providing customers with the systems-level solutions that best address their design needs. Among other aspects, the FSO rotation focuses on analyzing technical trade-offs, understanding component selection, and solving design and cost challenges.
   

  

 Rotation 2, Systems Engineering & Marketing (SEM): The SEM rotation provides hands-on experiences that help future FAEs understand how various TI components fit together to provide systems-level solutions for customer designs. This rotation focuses on technical product selection, schematic/layout capture, PCB layouts, fabrication processes, board bring up and validation.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Upon successful completion of the Field Applications Engineer track, participants are welcomed as FAEs on TI's Worldwide Sales & Applications team. FAE responsibilities include:
   

  

* Using various sales tools and relationships with design engineering to identify all potential projects
* Providing customers with proactive proposals for complete, system-level solutions that maximize TI content
* Using broad technical expertise to influence customers' part selection process while favorably positioning TI versus competition


 Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position.
   

  

**Start: October or December 2025**
**Qualifications**
**Minimum requirements:**
* Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Technology, Electrical Engineering Technology, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field
* Fluent in local language and English, both written and oral communication skills
* Basic understanding of schematics, layouts and digital components
* Knowledge and understanding of analog circuitry (examples include: op-amps, DC/DC power, data converters, sensing, etc.)
* Experience with lab equipment, like oscilloscopes, along with soldering and debugging skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, along with soldering and debugging skills
* Programming skills in C/C++ (LabView recommended)
* Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions
* Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery
* Ability to build lasting, influential relationships, both inside and outside the organization
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment
* Ability to take initiative and drive for results
* Ability to influence decisions through a sense of urgency and competitive drive


**About Us**
**Why TI?**
* Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
* We're different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
* Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.


**About Texas Instruments**
 Texas Instruments Incorporated (Nasdaq: TXN) is a global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures and sells analog and embedded processing chips for markets such as industrial, automotive, personal electronics, communications equipment and enterprise systems. At our core, we have a passion to create a better world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors. This passion is alive today as each generation of innovation builds upon the last to make our technology more reliable, more affordable and lower power, making it possible for semiconductors to go into electronics everywhere. Learn more at TI.com .
   

  

 Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment.
   

  

 If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition.
   

  

**About The Team**
 TI does not make recruiting or hiring decisions based on citizenship, immigration status or national origin. However, if TI determines that information access or export control restrictions based upon applicable laws and regulations would prohibit you from working in this position without first obtaining an export license, TI expressly reserves the right not to seek such a license for you and either offer you a different position that does not require an export license or decline to move forward with your employment.

title: Head of Market Management, Sweden
description:
We are looking for a Head of Market Management for Sweden, based in Stockholm.
   

  

**Your Team**
 Our Nordic team is a service minded and well-experienced team. Our local presence is growing and now consists of over 50 dedicated employees, located in Copenhagen, Helsinki and Stockholm, supporting Nordic clients with comprehensive and multinational risk transfer and insurance solutions.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
 Reporting to the Managing Director for Nordics and being part of a strong Nordic market management team of three experienced colleagues. Together with the Nordic market management team and underwriting team, you will drive our commercial relations with a large base of local clients and brokers in Sweden, ensuring sustainable and profitable growth by applying our solution- and service oriented strategic sales approach. In this role you will also be supporting your colleagues across Nordics. As a team you are also part of the Market management team in the Benelux and Nordic Region and will work closely also with this team under the leadership of our Regional Head of Distribution for Benelux and Nordics.
   

  

**Some of your specific responsibilities could include:**
* Represent and act as ambassador and go-to person for ALLIANZ COMMERCIAL on the Swedish market for large corp and upper mid corporate insurance solutions
* Drive for profitable growth of the Swedish portfolio by winning new business and successfully retaining and developing existing business
* Act as orchestrator internally in ALLIANZ COMMERCIAL between Lines of business and support-functions to secure a holistic client approach
* Foster robust and long-term relationships with ALLIANZ COMMERCIAL key brokers and clients and generate trust and credibility with key stakeholders at appropriate levels
* Facilitate brokers’ understanding of ALLIANZ COMMERCIAL’ underwriting appetite and core capabilities and position ALLIANZ COMMERCIAL as preferred insurer in its segment
* Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to identify and build a suitable customer pipeline and develop effective opportunity roadmaps to win new clients
* Proactively lead and coordinate bids for client acquisition and renewals
* Ensure deliverables are achieved and ensure smooth transition to the operational key account team
* Proactively develop in-depth client and industry expertise, using this to challenge the client and uncover unstated needs
* Proactively engage with the underwriting team to develop upsell and cross-sell opportunities and increase “share of wallet” with key brokers and clients and ensure structured pipeline and prospect management


**What You’ll Bring To The Role**
* Proven track record in market management activities within the Swedish and / or Nordic large corp and upper mid corporate insurance market
* Capable of driving strategic market management, defining client segmentation and communicating a clear value proposition
* Expert knowledge of the Swedish market and / or Nordic direct clients and broker landscape
* Proven success in building long-term relationships
* Able to proactively foster and build business opportunities, creating networks across multiple stakeholders
* Demonstrable success in driving profitable business, maintaining and developing existing business / new business
* Able to work and navigate in an international matrix organization, working alongside regional and global teams
* Strong communication skills, in both Swedish and English. Other Nordic language is an advantage.
* IT savvy with an eye to driving process improvement and bringing on board new digital ways of working
* Experience of SalesForce.com is positive
* Excited by a context of change, able to adapt and thrive in a context of transformation
* Experience in applying artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) to improve business processes and decision-making is highly beneficial.


 76096 | Sales & Distribution | Professional | Allianz Commercial | Full-Time | Permanent
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
**Let’s Care About Everything That Makes You, You**
 We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment where everyone feels they belong. We offer a hybrid working model, which recognizes the value of striking a balance between in-person collaboration and remote working. Please feel free to discuss flexible working arrangements with us.
   

  

**Let’s care for your financial wellbeing**
 We believe in rewarding performance with a great compensation and benefits package (details vary by location), including a generous bonus scheme and pension.
   

  

**Let’s care for your opportunities to progress**
 From career development and digital learning programs to international career mobility, we offer lifelong learning for our employees worldwide and an environment where innovation, delivery and empowerment are fostered.
   

  

**Let’s care for life’s twists and turns**
 From our support for flexible working, health and wellbeing (including private healthcare and generous parental leave benefits), to helping people return from career breaks with experience that nothing else can teach. We've got your back.
   

  

**Let’s care for our society and our planet**
 With opportunities to be engaged in shaping a future that is safe, inclusive and sustainable, we care for the tomorrows of our people, our industry and our clients.
   

  

**Care to join us?**
 Allianz Commercial is the center of expertise of Allianz Group, insuring mid-sized businesses, large enterprises, and special risks.Our customers include top consumer brands, financial institutions, industry leaders, the global aviation and shipping industries, as well as family-owned and medium-enterprises.We also cover unique risks such as offshore wind farms, infrastructure projects and film productions.Our clients trust us to provide a wide range of traditional and alternative risk transfer solutions, outstanding risk consulting and multinational services, and seamless claims handling.Allianz Commercial helps customers to prepare for what's ahead.
   

  

 Learn more about careers at Allianz Commercial by clicking here.
   

  

 Learn more about Allianz Commercial by clicking here.
   

  

 Allianz is an equal opportunity employer, and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability, sexual orientation or any other protected characteristic. Diversity of thinking is an important part of our culture.
   

  

**People with disabilities:**
 We want to give all our candidates the best opportunity to succeed.  If you need any adjustments to be made during the application and selection process, please email agcsglobalcareers@allianz.com
   

  

**Recruitment Agencies:**
 Allianz Commercial has an in-house recruitment team, which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly.  Allianz Commercial does not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters.  Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired.  When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so please do not contact managers directly.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**TL;DR**
 We’re looking for Founding ML Engineers who will shape how we fine-tune, serve, and evaluate LLMs and frontier models in production - and help define what it means to build a truly lovable AI product.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We’re Looking For**
* You’re a senior ML engineer with deep experience training and deploying large language models
* You’ve developed engineering best practices having worked at globally leading tech startups and scale-ups
* You’ve shipped ML systems in production, with real users and real uptime
* You understand how to build fast and still care about reproducibility, monitoring, and model performance
* You have strong opinions about model safety, latency, and helpfulness — but you’re not afraid to experiment
* You're a technical Swiss Army knife who can solve any problem thrown at you
* You ship fast and break through walls instead of waiting for doors
* You're comfortable not knowing everything but figuring it out anyway
* You have strong opinions about code quality but know when to move fast
* You’re based in Stockholm or willing to relocate, and excited to work on-site, full-time


**Your Responsibilities**
* Work closely with product engineers to integrate models into real user-facing features
* Build retrieval pipelines, evaluation frameworks, and experimentation tools
* Push the limits of what’s possible with current open models, and help define what we should train next
* Stay up to date with the bleeding edge of LLM research, and know when (and when not) to apply it


**Our tech stack** 
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next


**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your way of thinking during two technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system

title: KEY ACCOUNT MANAGER UNDER ARMOUR
description:
Under Armour är ett av världens ledande och mest snabbväxande sportvarumärken. Vill du vara en del av att bygga upp Under Armour i Norden? MnO söker en Key Account Manager som är ansvarig för vår försäljning av Under Armour till ett antal nyckelkunder och buying groups.
   

  

 Du är driven av försäljning och av att bygga långsiktiga relationer. Du är affärsdriven och tycker om att se hela affären från start till mål, dvs från förarbete till genomförsäljning och uppföljning, och ger bra service. Du har bra koll på marginal, avtal och rabattstruktur och att de är enligt plan och direktiv. Du är en lagspelare som ändå leds av ett personligt driv att uppnå högt uppsatta mål!
   

  

 Du är noggrann och drivs av ordning och reda gällande siffror. Du är social och hanterar nya relationer på ett bra sätt samt underhåller befintliga. Ditt ansvar spänner ifrån strategisk långsiktig planering till daglig operativt arbete.
   

  

 Vi söker medarbetare som är hungriga och vill utvecklas! Vi ser gärna att du kommer till oss med mycket erfarenhet och lärdomar och vill fortsätta att spetsa dina färdigheter hos oss. Vi erbjuder ett omväxlande arbete i en dynamisk organisation och ett av branschens snabbast växande och mest spännande varumärken!
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Skapa produktiva, professionella relationer med nyckelpersoner på tilldelade kundkonton
* Uppfylla tilldelade mål för lönsam försäljningsvolym och strategiska mål i tilldelade konton
* Proaktivt leda en gemensam företagsstrategisk planeringsprocess som utvecklar ömsesidiga prestationsmål, finansiella mål och kritiska milstolpar under en treårsperiod
* Proaktivt utvärdera, klargöra och validera kundbehov löpande
* Leda utveckling av lösningar som bäst tillgodoser kundernas behov, samtidigt som alla nödvändiga interna resurser engageras
* Du rapporterar direkt till VD/Säljchef, samt även till viss del direkt till Under Armours Europakontor i Amsterdam


**Din profil**
* Du har flerårig dokumenterad erfarenhet av försäljning, helst inom sportbranschen
* Det är meriterande med liknande tjänst ifrån andra varumärken
* Du är mycket strukturerad och fäster stor vikt vid siffror och detaljer
* Du är van vid att skapa och genomdriva långsiktiga strategiska planer
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande
* Du har god IT vana och är snabblärd i nya program och system, och behärskar framförallt Excel väl
* Du tycker om och är duktig på att hålla i presentationer, och behärskar PowerPoint väl
* Är en positiv lagspelare som gör affärer på ett professionellt och personligt sätt


 Låter detta som en roll och ett företag du skulle trivas på? Vi hoppas på det och är även nyfikna på vad du skulle vilja bidra med till oss!
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökan via e-post: jobb@mno.se märk din ansökan med ”UAKAM-2025-07”.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Country Manager Sweden Jimmie: jimmie.nielsen@mno.se
   

  

**Övrig information**
* Start enligt överenskommelse
* Placeringsort: Stockholm, Hammarby Sjöstad
* Omfattning: Heltid med 6 månaders provanställning
* Resor inom Sverige/Norden förekommer i tjänsten


 Välkommen in med en motiverande ansökan om varför just du skulle passa för denna roll!
   

  

 MnO International AB är ett distributionsföretag inom sport och mode. Bolaget har funnits sen 1997 och har sitt huvudkontor i Stockholm, med filialer i Göteborg, Helsingfors, Oslo och Köpenhamn. Försäljningen är idag till totalt 26 länder, med fokus på Skandinavien. Bolagets filosofi bygger på en stark och långsiktig relation med våra partners, återförsäljare, agenter och producenter, genom en effektiv och professionell organisation och ett starkt engagemang. Vi är ca 75 personer som sitter på 3000kvm med kontor och showrooms i Hammarby Sjöstad. För mer information se www.mno.se.

 B

 Heltid

 MNO International AB
