title: System Integration Specialist
description:
**Är du vår nya kundfokuserade System Integration Specialist?** 




  





**Som ett marknadsledande kredithanteringsföretag har Intrum en bred kompetens inom inkassotjänster och vi gör affärer i 20 länder i Europa. Vi har mer än 10 000 erfarna medarbetare i vår grupp.** 




 Vår verksamhet handlar om att hjälpa andra. Hjälpa skuldsatta individer att ta sig ur svåra situationer. Hjälpa företag att få betalt så att de kan växa, anställa och blomstra. Vilket i sin tur är positivt för hela ekonomin. Du blir en väsentlig del av denna krets hos oss, vilket ger ditt jobb på Intrum en djupare mening. Oavsett din roll eller titel.
 



  





**Att ligga i framkant är allas jobb** 




 Som marknadsledare är det upp till oss att ligga i framkant. Att forma branschen. Att sätta nya standarder. Och vart än i världen din Intrum-karriärväg tar dig, vilken roll du än spelar, kommer du att bidra till tillväxt, innovation och inverkan som gör verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Att ha möjlighet att växa** 




 I vår organisation finns det många möjligheter att avancera, specialisera sig och rotera. Eller till och med prova dina vingar utomlands. Det är upp till dig att få det att hända. Att vår verksamhet handlar om att hjälpa andra – privatpersoner och företag, gör att ditt arbete också utvecklas på ett mer personligt plan. Enkelt uttryckt, du kommer att växa genom att göra skillnad.
 



  





**Rollen** 




**Rollen kommer att rapportera till Anna Björklund, Input/Output Specialists** 




**Plats för denna position: Stockholm** 




 Hybridarbete. Vi ser att hybridarbete, där vi som medarbetare kan arbeta antingen hemifrån eller från kontoret, skapar möjligheter att prestera och arbeta effektivt i virtuella och reella miljöer.
 



  





 Som System Integration Specialist inom fakturaservicetjänsten, arbetar du med teknisk integration mellan kundens system och Intrums system. Varje implementering genomförs av en projektgrupp där du blir en nyckelspelare. Din roll blir att upprätta kommunikation för filöverföring i samverkan med kunden, ta fram struktur inför inläsning av kundfiler och genomföra integrationstester. Du kommer också att arbeta med teknisk support samt förvaltning av befintliga integrationer/kunder. Rollen innebär att du samverkar med kunder, samarbetspartners inom IT och andra interna funktioner. Du erbjuds ett dynamiskt och skapande arbete där du får möjlighet att utveckla dina kunskaper, samtidigt som du bidrar till att optimera kopplingen mellan affärsverksamhet och teknik. I rollen har du många kontaktytor och stor påverkan på hur Intrums kunder upplever Intrums tjänster och bidrar till bolagets framgång.
 



 Som System Integration Specialist ingår du i avdelningen Input/Output Specialists som är en del av enheten Invoicing Tillsammans med Produkt, försäljning och kundsupport jobbar vår enhet nära Intrums alla kunder.
 



  





**Dina kvalifikationer** 




 • Erfarenhet av kundnära samarbete
 



 • Ett stort tekniskt intresse och förståelse
 



 • Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
 



 • God vana och kunskap i Office-paketet
 



 • Meriterande med erfarenhet av integrationer/XML/Jira samt filöverföring
 



  





**Vem är du** 




 Vi på Intrum vill bidra till ett inkluderande och mångsidigt arbetsliv. Vi accepterar våra olikheter och vet att detta är en styrka. Vi vet att vi alla är en resurs för samhället, oavsett ålder, funktionsförmåga, kön, religion, etnicitet eller sexuell läggning. Därför uppmanar vi alla att söka jobb hos oss.
 **Kom som du är.** 




 För att trivas i rollen tror vi du är en ansvarsfull person som arbetar noggrant, strukturerat och effektivt. Du är flexibel och lösningsfokuserad, har lätt för att anpassa dig till rådande situation och prioritera, och optimera, när situationen kräver. Du tycker om att ha kundkontakt och motiveras av att skapa nöjda kunder och bidra til lönsamma affärer. Att alltid ge god service och bygga goda relationer kommer naturligt för dig.
 




  





  





**Du agerar enligt våra värderingar. Våra värderingar är inte ord. De är allt.** 




 Bakom vår globala expansion och stora digitala transformation ligger fyra enkla men kraftfulla värden. Etik. Hängivenhet. Lösningar. Empati. Det är värderingarna som driver vår vardag, oavsett hur stora vi blir. Andra kanske tycker att de är små saker. Men för oss, är de allt.
 








**Är du nyfiken och har frågor?** 




  





 Välkommen att kontakta rekryteringschefen för mer information om affärsenheten och rollen. Och tveka inte att kontakta den primära rekryteraren för mer information om ansökningsprocessen.
 



  





  





 Endast ansökningar som tas emot via vårt onlinesystem kommer att beaktas.

title: Projektledare med erfarenhet av journalsystem
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 Projektledaren ska ansvara för att driva och samordna införandet av tidbok i journalsystem såsom TakeCare,Life Care Tidbok, Kaddio och Webdoc. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan med kommunens systemförvaltare, verksamhetsrepresentanter
   

  

 samt externa leverantörer.
   

  

 Uppdraget innefattar bland annat att:
   

  

* Leda projektet från start till mål med tydlig struktur och planering.
* Bygga upp och anpassa tidbokningssystemet utifrån verksamhetens behov.
* Kalkylera och analysera tidsåtgång samt bedöma tidseffektiviseringar.
* Optimera användning av rum, mötesbokningar och tillgängliga resurser.
* Leda och samordna teamet av systemförvaltare under projektperioden.
* Säkerställa förankring hos verksamheten och upprätta en hållbar förvaltningsstruktur.
* Arbeta nära verksamheten med förståelse för dess förutsättningar och behov, särskilt inom vård och omsorg.


**Kompetenskrav:**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av projektledning inom IT- och systemförvaltning.
* God förståelse för ekonomiska analyser kopplat till tid och resursanvändning.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med journalsystem och tidbokningsfunktionalitet.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom vård och omsorg, med förståelse för verksamhetslogik och krav.
* Förmåga att leda tvärfunktionella team och arbeta strukturerat mot uppsatta mål.


**Leveransvillkor:**
 Projektstart 5 maj eller enligt överenskommelse. Överlämning av projektet till verksamheten 1 september eller enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten levereras löpande till Beställaren med regelbundna avstämningar mellan Leverantör och Beställare. Uppskattad tidsåtgång under projekttiden motsvarar ca 250 timmar.
   

  

**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Storkundsansvarig
description:
**Vill du vara med och bygga ett av världens mest snabbväxande sportvarumärken i Norden?** 




  





 Under Armour är ett av världens ledande varumärken inom sport och performance. Vi på MnO International söker nu en affärsdriven och relationsskapande Key Account Manager till vårt team. I den här rollen ansvarar du för försäljningen av Under Armour till nyckelkunder och buying groups inom Sverige och Norden.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du har ett starkt driv för försäljning, älskar att bygga långsiktiga relationer och har en god förståelse för affären från strategi till genomförande och uppföljning. Du är van vid att arbeta med marginaler, avtal och rabattstrukturer och ser till att allt följer satta mål och riktlinjer. Du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera strategi med det dagliga operativa arbetet och drivs av att skapa resultat.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden** 




 • Bygga och utveckla starka, professionella relationer med nyckelpersoner hos tilldelade kunder
 



 • Uppnå uppsatta mål för lönsamhet, försäljningsvolym och strategiska KPI:er
 



 • Leda gemensam strategisk planering med kunder med tydliga mål och milstolpar
 



 • Identifiera och förstå kunders behov och omsätta det i relevanta lösningar
 



 • Samordna interna resurser och säkerställa att kundernas behov tillgodoses
 



 • Rapportera till MnOs försäljningschef samt ha dialog med Under Armours Europakontor i Amsterdam
 



  





**Din profil** 




 • Flerårig erfarenhet av försäljning, gärna från sport- eller modebranschen
 



 • Meriterande med tidigare erfarenhet från liknande roll hos ett internationellt varumärke
 



 • Affärsorienterad, noggrann och strukturerad med god analytisk förmåga
 



 • Bekväm med att arbeta strategiskt och driva långsiktiga affärsrelationer
 



 • Flytande i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
 



 • God IT-vana, särskilt i Excel och PowerPoint
 



 • En lagspelare med höga ambitioner och stark egen drivkraft
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Ett omväxlande och utvecklande arbete i en dynamisk och entreprenöriell organisation med möjlighet att påverka och bidra till Under Armours tillväxt i Norden. Här får du vara en del av ett engagerat team och ett av branschens mest spännande varumärken.
 



  





**Praktisk information** 




 • Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 • Placeringsort: Stockholm, Hammarby Sjöstad
 



 • Omfattning: Heltid med sex månaders provanställning
 



 • Resor: Förekommer inom Sverige och Norden
 



 • Lön: Fast lön med rörlig bonus
 



 • Körkort: B-körkort krävs
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter det här som rätt roll för dig? Skicka din ansökan med personligt brev och CV till:
 **jobb@mno.se** 




 Ange referens:
 **UAKAM-2025-07** 




 Urval sker löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta:
 



**Jimmie Nielsen, Country Manager Sweden** 




 Mail: jimmie.nielsen@mno.se
 



  





**Om MnO International AB** 




 MnO International är ett distributionsföretag inom sport och mode med huvudkontor i Stockholm samt filialer i Helsingfors, Oslo och Köpenhamn. Företaget grundades 1997 och verkar idag på 26 marknader med fokus på Skandinavien. Vi bygger starka och långsiktiga relationer med återförsäljare och partners genom ett professionellt arbetssätt, hög servicenivå och stort engagemang. Vi är cirka 75 medarbetare och har 2 000 kvadratmeter kontor och showroom i Hammarby Sjöstad.
 



 Läs mer på www.mno.se

title: Marketing and Sales Manager Major Campaigns AEW
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Saab is a place where teamwork makes things fly. Literally. Join us and experience our supportive and friendly workplace.*
 Your role
   

  

 In this high-impact position, you'll be at the forefront of our marketing, sales, and capture strategies for GlobalEye. Collaborating with a talented team and key stakeholders across Saab, you'll secure major contracts worldwide and report directly to the Head of Marketing and Sales BU AEW. This is your chance to make a significant impact and shape the future of Airborne Early Warning & Control (AEW&C) solutions.
   

  

 Your Impact:
   

  

* Drive Growth: Develop and implement winning strategies to expand GlobalEye's market share and secure major contracts.
* Lead and Inspire: Build and mentor a high-performing team, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
* Shape the Future: Position our product as the leading AEW&C solution globally, contributing to Saab's growth ambitions.


 Your Profile:
   

  

 We're experiencing a surge in demand for our cutting-edge GlobalEye system, and we need a proven leader to capitalize on this growth. If you have a passion for technology, a strategic mindset, and a track record of success in complex sales environments, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* Leadership: Extensive experience in leading and developing high-performing teams.
* Sales & Capture Expertise: Deep understanding of the sales and capture management lifecycle for large-scale projects, ideally within the defence or aerospace industry.
* Global Mindset: Experience working with international customers and partners, with excellent communication and presentation skills in English. Swedish fluency is a plus.
* Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and execute innovative marketing and sales strategies.
* Flexibility and Collaboration: Willingness to travel internationally and work effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional environment.


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: Entreprenadingenjör (Stockholm, DE, 117 61)
description:
**Var med och bygg en hållbar framtid med oss - ett familjärt bolag med internationell etablering. Implenia Sverige söker nu en entreprenadingenjör till vårt kontor i Stockholm.**
**Din framtida roll**
 Rollen som entreprenadingenjör hos oss är en bred roll som kan se olika ut beroende på vilka projekt vi har för närvarande och vilka frågor som är aktuella att hantera. Du kommer att utgå från kontoret i Stockholm, men även sitta ute i projekt beroende på vilka projekt som behöver stöd. Rollen är kopplad till funktionen Legal, vilket innebär att du kommer att stötta projekten både i tekniska och en del juridiska frågeställningar kopplade till kontrakten.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
* Stötta våra projekt i kommunikation och förhandling med avtalsparter såsom beställare, underentreprenörer och konsulter
* Identifiera avvikelser och ändringar i utförande/projektering
* Hantera och besvara underrättelser i projekt
* Arbeta nära projekt och produktion för att säkerställa uppföljning mot ÄTA-arbeten och underrättelser
* Aktivt bidra till projektets hantering av kontraktsfrågor
* Hantera interna avvikelser
* Utreda och sammanställa eventuella tvistiga frågor mot avtalsparter
* Bistå Legal i att hålla internutbildningar för projekten


**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av komplexa entreprenadjuridiska frågor inom anläggning och infrastruktur. Vi ser gärna att du har viss teknisk utbildning och även grundläggande kunskaper i juridik samt att du har ett par års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
   

  

 Vi förväntar oss att du kan arbeta självständigt och visa egen initiativförmåga i utredning av kontraktsfrågor och att du har relevant erfarenhet för kontraktshantering inom stora komplexa infrastrukturprojekt. Du har goda IT-kunskaper inom framför allt Excel och SharePoint, men även kunskap inom andra program kan vara meriterande. Du har god förmåga att se helheten och är inte rädd för att ställa krav i arbetet likaväl som du är stöttande till de personer du arbetar nära med.
   

  

 B-körkort erfordras.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med sex månaders provanställning. Du kommer att utgå från vårt kontor i Stockholm. Som en del av Implenia kan du förvänta dig ett varierande arbete med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Du blir en del av en organisation där du får frihet under eget ansvar samtidigt som du har positiva och samarbetsvilliga kollegor att växa och kompetensutvecklas med. Våra medarbetare är vår främsta styrka och det är viktigt att alla känner sig trygga hos oss och trivs på jobbet. På Implenia värderar vi mångfald, vår rekryteringsprocess är därför inriktad på att främja jämställdhet och inkludering.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Implenia Sverige AB har närmare 450 anställda och många års erfarenhet och kompetens inom utmanande och komplexa infrastrukturprojekt. Vi är rikstäckande med projekt över hela Sverige och våra kontor är belägna i Stockholm och Göteborg. Implenia Sverige AB är en del av Implenia Group, som är den ledande leverantören av byggtjänster i Schweiz och är etablerade i flertalet europeiska länder.
   

  

 Registrera din ansökan och CV nedan gärna så snart som möjligt. Vi kommer att börja gå igenom ansökningarna efter sommaren. Vid frågor kontakta HR-Generalist Nina, nina.cakarevic@implenia.com

title: Brand Manager - OTC, Consumer Healthcare
description:
Our current Brand Manager is moving to a new position in our global organization and we are therefor seeking a new colleague for the team in Sweden.
   

  

 Are you a strategic and passionate Brand Manager with a background in pharmaceuticals? Do you want to drive growth and shape the future of OTC and Consumer Healthcare brands in a dynamic, purpose-driven company? If so, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Join us at Orifarm as our new Brand Manager OTC, a pivotal role where you’ll take the lead in building and executing growth strategies, launching new products and brands, managing the product portfolio and owning brand communication in close collaboration with key pharmacy customers and internal stakeholders.
   

  

 As Brand Manager OTC, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading growth initiatives with a main focus on the OTC category
* Developing and executing strong Go-To-Market and communication plans
* Managing brand strategy, portfolio planning, and leading sell-in presentations to central pharmacy customers
* Coordinating campaign development from concept to regulatory approval
* Driving new product development (NPD), analysing business cases, sales and market data and collaborating with the Global team to shape the Swedish OTC portfolio
* Managing contacts with agencies and partners with a consumer- and customer-centric approach
* Supporting OTC projects and advising internally on medical-scientific matter.
* Creating and reviewing communication (and educational ) material for both consumers and HCPs, ensuring compliance with Swedish pharmaceutical marketing regulations


 This is a role with both strategic and operational responsibilities, ideal for someone who enjoys taking ideas from concept to execution. You will be reporting to Head of Consumer Healthcare Sweden, Marina Eriksdotter.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We’re looking for a seasoned Brand Manager who thrives in a fast-moving environment and has a deep understanding of the pharmaceutical market.
   

  

 We expect you to have:
   

  

* Minimum 3 years’ experience in a Brand Manager role within the pharmaceutical industry, Category manger from Pharmacy chains, or equivalent
* Preferably experience working with central pharmacy customers
* A degree as Pharmacist (preferred) or relevant academic background in Life Sciences or Business
* Solid understanding of either OTC, Consumer Healthcare, Medical Devise (previous experience in OTC is a strong plus)
* Project management skills
* Commercial mindset
* Fluency in Swedish and English
* Good understanding of pharmaceutical regulations and ethical rules (e.g. LVFS 2009:6, LIF LER);
* IMA certification is a merit


 Additionally, it is important that you are:
   

  

* Strategic yet hands-on
* A self-starter who takes ownership and drives results
* Analytical, creative, and structured
* A collaborative team player with strong communication skills
* Easily navigates in a complex industry with many stakeholders both internal and external


**Who are we?**
 Our office in Stockholm is brand new and centrally located, just a few minutes from T-centralen. We work in a hybrid model and enjoy social activities together.
   

  

 At Orifarm, we combine entrepreneurial spirit with a strong sense of purpose – to make healthcare accessible and affordable. You’ll be part of a passionate, supportive team with high ambitions and a genuine commitment to improving people’s lives.
   

  

**Why should you work for Orifarm?**
 At Orifarm, we know that our growth comes from the development of our employees. We are an ambitious organization with an entrepreneurial culture celebrating can-do attitudes, smarts, and hearts. Our secret to success? Valuing how different skill sets join forces to make our journey happen.
   

  

 You will experience a work environment characterized by flexibility and a strong commitment to work-life balance, understanding that the best results come from satisfied and well-supported employees. Our international setting offers great opportunities for growth and career advancement. We also prioritize social events and gatherings to ensure that our employees feel connected and engaged with each other.
   

  

 We regard our feedback culture as a fundamental element in the individual employee's opportunities for learning and development. When we have good results, every employee, including student workers, is part of our bonus scheme.
   

  

**About Orifarm**
 Everyone should have access to modern medicine. High costs or lack of access to pharmaceuticals should never impact our possibility to receive treatment or relief and live a healthy life. At Orifarm, we aim to bring healthy days by making modern healthcare a better deal for the people and the societies we serve. Working towards our vision, we create access to affordable, high-quality pharmaceuticals and healthcare products by challenging markets and always seeking new opportunities. With our core values paving the way, we always act responsibly and constantly with our customers at the center of our attention. And everything we do is driven by our sole purpose:
   

  

 For as many as possible, as healthy a day as possible.
   

  

 Our history goes back to 1994 when Orifarm was founded in Denmark by Hans and Birgitte Bøgh-Sørensen. Since then, Orifarm has grown from a small nine-person company into an international company operating globally in 15 countries. Today, Orifarm is Europe's largest parallel importer of pharmaceuticals and Denmark's largest supplier of pharmaceuticals, with more than 2,200 employees.
   

  

**We encourage everyone to apply**
 At Orifarm, we welcome people from all backgrounds, recognizing that the best outcomes come from a diverse and inclusive work environment. Our commitment is to create an environment where different perspectives and skills drive innovation and contribute to a sustainable future. By creating such an environment, we are confident that we can achieve better results together.
   

  

**Job Location**
 Stockholm in our new office near T-Centralen.
   

  

 We are often looking for new employees to help us grow and therefore, we may have other interesting opportunities for you. Follow us on LinkedIn to receive updates on our business activities and job opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/ . Alternatively, if we do not have any vacant positions that match your interests at this time, we encourage you to submit your resume to our talent pool, from which we continuously select candidates: https://careers.orifarm.com/lp/TalentPool/28c5a1691eef5fd4/ .
   

  

**Application deadline**
 ASAP

title: Lead Electrical Commissioning Engineer Contract - Sweden
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Architecture and Planning
description:
At HDR, our employee-owners are fully engaged in creating a welcoming environment where each of us is valued and respected, a place where everyone is empowered to bring their authentic selves and novel ideas to work every day. As we work to weave diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and foster a sense of belonging throughout the company and within our communities, we constantly ask ourselves: What is our impact on the world?
   

  

 Watch Our Story:' https://www.hdrinc.com/our-story'
   

  

 Each and every role throughout our organization makes a difference in our ability to change the world for the better. Read further to learn how you could help make great things possible not only in your community, but around the world.
   

  

****Responsibilities****
 The role of our
 **Lead Electrical Commissioning Engineer in Gavle, Sweden** 
 is to ensure that building services systems are, will be or have been commissioned properly and in accordance with the relevant requirements.
   

  

* Ensuring that our commitments to our clients are met on time and to the required level of detail and quality
* Managing the electrical commissioning process
* Validating the electrical commissioning process and ensuring that the results achieved are in line with requirements
* Inspecting existing systems to determine their performance
* Advise on electrical commissioning and performance requirements, commissioning strategies, programs, scopes of work and the like
* Carrying out measurements, surveys and other technical inspections
* Collaborate with other members of the organization to improve existing systems and procedures
* Acting as a champion in an area of particular technical interest
* Promote the company and the whole group through marketing activities
* Forward planning of equipment required for testing
* Assisting in the preparation of tender documents
* Accurate completion of timesheets on a weekly basis
* Proactively assisting other staff in the performance of their work


****Responsibilities****
* Acting safely at all times in accordance with the company's health and safety policies and procedures
* Work diligently, efficiently and professionally at all times
* Ensuring technical compliance and high quality production of our products
* Working closely with the main contractor's team to develop commissioning strategies and processes that fully meet the project objectives
* Fully adopt the company's project and internal management systems
* Maintain a keen awareness of project finances and control of related expenditure
* Attend meetings as required
* Produce internal and client reports that include technical, commercial and programmatic aspects
* Development of project specific management/validation documents and procedures for commissioning
* Technical commentary on drawings, manuals and technical submissions
* Development of project-specific procedural instructions, test scripts and the like
* Awareness and internal reporting of project scope changes
* Working with other members of a professional team to assess progress, difficulties and costs
* Perform hands-on commissioning work as required


****Preferred Qualifications****
* BEng Electrical Engineering with Building Services.
* Considerable experience will be sought to demonstrate project management skills.
* Additional Modules Considered Useful: Construction Contract Law, Construction Project Management, Building Services Engineering, Environmental System Design, Lighting Design, Energy in Buildings, Time Management and Presentation courses.
* Member of CIBSE, ASHRAE or equivalent professional qualifications an advantage.
* At least 5-10 years of experience in a project management/commissioning management role in a building orientated company in the building types Commercial, Residential, Life Science, Health Care.
* Worked within company Quality & Environmental policies and procedures.
* IT Literate – MS Office package.


****Required Qualifications****
* 4 years of industry experience dealing with mechanical, electrical and controls disciplines

title: Cloud Security Engineer for Google Cloud Platform
description:
**Introduktion**  
Åt stora statliga kunder söker vi flera personer som har nedan profil! Rekryteringsmöjligheterna dyker upp löpande varför vi tar ansökningar löpande. Se bara till att passa in i profilen som nämns nedan så återkommer vi till dig!

**Beskrivning av uppdraget/rollen**

Uppdragsbeskrivning

**For our client we are looking for a** **Cloud Security Engineer for Google Cloud Platform****.**

We are looking for a Cloud Platform Engineer with hands-on experience in GCP infrastructure and platform engineering to join our client’s central cloud platform team. The team is responsible for building and maintaining the GCP landing zone, governance frameworks, and central services that enable product teams to securely and efficiently deploy applications and analytics in the cloud.

This role requires deep knowledge of GCP architecture and components (e.g., IAM, networking, logging, monitoring), proficiency in Terraform, and a track record of automating infrastructure and enabling self-service capabilities. You’ll work on foundational elements like Shared VPCs, Workload Identity Federation (WIF), and centralized policy enforcement, as well as collaborate with product teams to provide best practices and architectural support.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Enhance and maintain the **GCP landing zone**, including governance, networking, and security frameworks
* Design, build, and manage **central platform services** (e.g., BigQuery quota control, WIF, PAM integrations)
* Implement and improve **automation and self-service capabilities** across the platform
* Provide architectural guidance and support to product and analytics teams on GCP services (e.g., IAM, VPC, Cloud Run, Vertex AI)
* Contribute to defining and enforcing best practices around infrastructure, security, observability, and cost optimization
* Collaborate with stakeholders such as Security, DevOps, and Application Teams to ensure compliance and scalability of cloud solutions

**Required Qualifications:**

* 3+ years of **hands-on experience with GCP**, particularly in platform engineering and infrastructure architecture
* Proven experience with **Terraform** and infrastructure-as-code practices
* Deep understanding of **GCP services** such as IAM, VPC, Cloud Monitoring, BigQuery, and Cloud Run
* Experience in managing **Shared VPC**, setting up **Workload Identity Federation (WIF)**, and developing central platform policies
* Strong scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or similar)
* Experience working in large-scale environments with a **platform team or cloud center of excellence**
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience with **policy-as-code frameworks** (e.g., OPA/Constraint Templates)
* Familiarity with **Vertex AI** or **GCP-native ML/analytics workflows**
* Experience in building internal developer platforms or portals

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
**TL;DR**
=========


We’re looking for an exceptional platform engineer to design and scale the infrastructure behind the future of AI software engineering. You’ll own key parts of our backend, devops, and platform tooling - ensuring speed, reliability, and scalability across our stack.

**Why Lovable?**
================

* **Change the world, literally:** 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* **Work, learn, have fun:** We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* **Build a unique network:** Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* **Get autonomy & ownership:** With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* **Compensation:** Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis

**What we’re looking for**
==========================

* You have 5-7+ years of experience building production infrastructure as a Platform Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer or similar
* You’ve helped scale platforms at global tech startups and scale-ups - startup experience is a must
* You’ve worked on distributed systems, CI/CD pipelines, internal tooling, observability, and cloud infrastructure
* You have experience with Docker, Kubernetes and modern infra practices
* You have strong programming skills and a track record of improving dev velocity and system reliability
* You’re a problem-solver who thrives on challenges and ships high-leverage systems fast
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and figuring things out on the fly
* You care about security, stability, and speed—but know when to optimize and when to move
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role

**Your responsibilities**
=========================

**In one sentence:** Own and scale the platform that makes AI engineering work for everyone

* Build and maintain the systems that power our AI product—from backend performance to cloud deployments
* Improve developer experience: streamline our CI/CD pipelines, internal tools, and observability stack
* Harden our infrastructure against failures, downtime, and slowdowns
* Collaborate across teams - from product, frontend and backend - to ensure fast and reliable delivery
* Own your roadmap, architect systems, and carry them through to deployment

**Our tech stack**
==================


We build with tools both humans and AI love:

* **Frontend:** React for lightning-fast interfaces
* **Backend:** Golang and Rust for serious performance
* **Cloud**: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* **DevOps & Tooling:** CI/CD pipelines, observability, infra-as-code—you help shape this layer


And we’re always exploring what’s next.

**How applying works**
======================

* Fill in a short form, then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your thinking during two technical interviews
* Join us on-site for 1–2 days of trial work if possible - get to know the team and see if Lovable is the right place for you

**About your application**
==========================


Please submit your application in English (our company language). We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested, apply through our system using the link below.

title: Security Engineer
description:
**Security Engineer till Cparta Cyber Defense**
**Cparta Cyber Defense är ett snabbt växande kommersiellt företag inom cyberförsvar med ett tydligt syfte – att bidra till ett tryggare och säkrare samhälle. Vi skyddar inte bara våra kunders digitala tillgångar, utan är också en aktiv del i att stärka Sveriges cyberresiliens i en tid där hotbilden ständigt förändras.**
**Genom att kombinera spetskompetens med ett djupt samhällsengagemang är vi med och försvarar demokratin, näringslivet och människors integritet. Vår kultur präglas av mod, innovation, ödmjukhet och stark teamkänsla.**
**Vi söker fler som delar vår övertygelse: att verklig förändring skapas tillsammans – och att vi hand i hand kan göra Sverige säkrare.**
**Om Rollen**
 Som Security Engineer i vårt dynamiska Cyber Defense-team kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att skydda våra kunder mot cyberhot. Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Bygga och konfigurera avancerade säkerhetsövervaknings- och analyslösningar som förbättrar visibiliteten och detekteringsförmågan för vårt blue team (CDC/IR/TH/CTI).
* Utveckla och underhålla lösningar för logghantering, tolkning och automatisering, samt implementera use cases i vår SIEM.


**Ditt Dagliga Arbete Kommer Att Bestå Av**
* Installera, konfigurera och underhålla servrar och applikationer för säkerhetsövervakning och incidenthantering.
* Utveckla och integrera automatiseringslösningar som gör att verktyg fungerar sömlöst tillsammans.
* Designa och utveckla plugins och fristående program för att komplettera befintlig programvara.


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Minst två års erfarenhet av SOC-relaterade tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD.
* Gedigen kunskap inom SIEM och relaterade verktyg.
* God erfarenhet av Python-utveckling.
* Grundläggande nätverkskunskaper och erfarenhet av skriptspråk som bash och awk.


**Så här ser vår rekryteringsprocess ut**
 Vi tror på att skapa en personlig och transparent process där både du och vi får lära känna varandra på riktigt.
   

  

* Första steget är en intervju på vårt centrala kontor på Kungsgatan 37, där du träffar din blivande chef för ett samtal om vem du är och vad vi står för som bolag.
* Därefter får du möta några av dina framtida teamkollegor – ett viktigt tillfälle för att både känna in dynamiken och fördjupa oss i din kompetens.
* Nästa steg är ett förmånssamtal med HR där vi går igenom erbjudandet, villkor och förmåner.
* Referenser
* Om vi alla känner att vi har en match, så följer en säkerhetsintervju på plats. I det skedet genomför vi även bakgrundskontroll.


**Krav**
 För att arbeta hos oss måste du vara svensk medborgare, ostraffad och genomgå en bakgrundskontroll.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta Benjamin Karlsson på
 **b** 
**ka@cparta.se** 
 . Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt och bli en del av vårt växande team.
   

  

 Cparta was founded in 2020, with the conviction that the solution to the security challenges of digitalization is to build a Collective Commercial Cyber Defense (C3D) together. Cpartas Vision is to defend the digital integrity of Swedish critical societal functions and intellectual property. The Mission is to create this Collective Commercial Cyber Defense (C3D) to enable clients to leverage digitalization.
   

  

 C3D is a commercial initiative inspired by the Swedish doctrine of “Totalförsvar” for the Cyber domain. Cparta focuses on protecting critical infrastructure and vital intellectual property and industry since these are essential for Swedish society and national competitiveness. Cpartas clients and partners networks are key to collect and share valuable data and experiences, helping each other to become more safe.

title: Solution Architect – Shape the Future of Mobility with Aimo
description:
**About The Role**
 At Aimo, we believe smarter cities start with smarter mobility. As we continue to build a future-proof digital ecosystem, we’re looking for a Solution Architect to connect business strategy with the right technical solutions – and turn complexity into clarity.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in defining architecture patterns, shaping governance, and ensuring architectural investments align with long-term capability evolution. You’ll collaborate closely with enterprise architects and business stakeholders to guide how our technical solutions support strategic objectives – while mentoring others and influencing architectural thinking across domains.
   

  

 You’ll work across platforms and teams, translating both functional and non-functional requirements into scalable, secure, and maintainable architecture. Using tools like ArchiMate or UML, you ensure clarity, alignment, and documentation that enable efficient delivery and decision-making.
   

  

 In short: this is a role where strategic impact and technical depth go hand in hand.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

* Design and evolve Aimo’s system architecture in line with business goals and future scalability
* Define and productize APIs and standardize integration flows across platforms
* Take architectural ownership of critical backend systems, including legacy modernization
* Partner with enterprise and business architects to align on strategic direction
* Translate functional and non-functional requirements into robust architectural solutions
* Guide development teams across the Nordics with clarity, structure, and mentorship
* Shape and participate in architectural forums, governance, and portfolio planning
* Use modeling tools to drive structure, alignment, and documentation


**About You**
 You’re a systems thinker who thrives in complexity and brings clarity where others see ambiguity. You’re not only technically strong – with a solid background in solution architecture, cloud platforms, and systems integration – but also someone who leads through collaboration, trust, and structure.
   

  

 You take initiative, follow through on your commitments, and balance long-term vision with short-term delivery. You're confident guiding others, yet open to being challenged. You communicate clearly across roles, and you're the kind of person who improves how things are done – not by waiting to be asked, but because you care about the bigger picture.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

* Solid experience as a Solution Architect or in a similar senior role
* Strong skills in cloud architecture (preferably AWS), microservices, API design, and integration
* Experience with ERP/CRM systems, data platforms, and DevOps practices
* Familiarity with modeling tools (e.g., ArchiMate, UML) and agile delivery environments
* Fluency in English; Swedish or Finnish is a plus


**About Us**
 Aimo is rethinking mobility – combining technology, sustainability, and simplicity to create better everyday experiences. With operations across the Nordics, we’re building digital solutions that enable smart urban living.
   

  

 At Aimo, you’ll join a team that values curiosity, collaboration, and action. We believe in creating impact – not just through what we build, but how we work together.
   

  

**Ready to shape how we move through our cities tomorrow?**
 Apply now – or reach out to learn more.

title: Regional Vice President, Nordics
description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
At Workday, we value our candidates’ privacy and data security. Workday will never ask candidates to apply to jobs through websites that are not Workday Careers.  

Please be aware of sites that may ask for you to input your data in connection with a job posting that appears to be from Workday but is not.  

In addition, Workday will never ask candidates to pay a recruiting fee, or pay for consulting or coaching services, in order to apply for a job at Workday.
About the Team
Workday is looking for a Regional Vice President, Nordics to lead and grow a world-class team of Regional Sales Directors and Account Executives selling next generation Enterprise Cloud Applications.  

As the leader of a critical sector that directly impacts the overall company goal, he/she will have the growth potential to take on larger responsibilities as Workday looks to double in size and beyond in the coming years.
About the Role
The ideal candidate will have built and led high performing sales teams across our growth markets, across industry verticals and across a broad Enterprise Cloud portfolio, with a strong track record of driving innovation, scalability and disruptive thinking. This person needs to be an expert at positioning business value, selling enterprise software solutions, managing complex sales cycles and building relationships with key stakeholders.* Guide and manage the activities of the their assigned sector to ensure that company revenue goals and objectives are exceeded
* Develop and execute on a business plan to expand the Workday footprint
* Managing daily and weekly activities, pipelines, forecasts and closed deals to ensure above quota results based on successful pipeline management
* Attracting, hiring, on-boarding and retaining top sales talent
* Display a thorough understanding of business needs and revenue potential for accounts in the assigned region
* Work with team members individually as needed while always promoting a healthy team environment
* Supporting the sales team in their sales meetings with prospects
* Leveraging metrics to measure results
* Demonstrating the value placed on continued training and education through the enforcement of the Workday Way
* Function as a change agent, demonstrating his/her ability to uphold the standards consistent with a strong pipeline management system that leverages its own relevant performance data
* Function in a strategic capacity while enforcing tactical team performance issues
* Building a results-driven culture of accountability and transparency
* Maintaining an external focus, championing shareholder interests and focusing on customers in decision-making
* Serving as a visionary, articulating a compelling, long-term vision for the future, inspiring others to action
* Demonstrating strategic thought leadership, engaging in reengineering to redeploy invested capital to higher value opportunities
* Exemplifying logic in making decisions based on relevant facts and data, not assumptions and hope


About You
The Regional Vice President, Nordics will be a seasoned executive with tremendous drive, intelligence and capability. She/he will be highly motivated and have the ability and desire to have an impact on the future of the business. The successful candidate will be a multi-dimensional thinker who operates not only on the basis of important past experiences, but in light of new approaches and developments that occur in the market.
Additional personal and professional attributes include:* Minimum of 10+ years enterprise software sales experience successfully selling solutions at the C-level with 4+ years of sales management experience. 2nd line sales management experience is a plus.
* Experience managing and building a team of successful SaaS and/or Cloud sales professionals and ability to train RSDs and AEs
* Proven leadership ability to influence, develop and empower employees to achieve objectives with a team approach
* Strong track record of exceeding company sales quotas and forecasts in a complex sales environment
* Experience in territory management and planning, at the regional and account levels
* Proven expertise with teaching, coaching and training sales methodologies
* Strong written, verbal, presentation and organizational skills required
* Willing to travel as needed

  

Our Approach to Flexible Work  

With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

title: Lead Data Analytics
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.  

  

Are you a skilled data analyst with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can identify data-driven opportunities, mitigate challenges, and enhance decision-making accuracy? If you enjoy working in a small, agile team, we want to hear from you!


At Volvo Group, we recognize the importance of data and data-driven development in our industry. We are seeking an innovative and dedicated individual to join our team and help us enhance our development operations and services through data analytics and insights. Together, we will drive the data transformation and ensure that our customers succeed.

**What you will do**
--------------------


As Lead Data Analyst, you will be part of a newly established team focused on advancing our analytics journey. Your mission will be to empower the organization to become more proficient in utilizing data and generating insights. You will engage with stakeholders to understand their pain points and lead necessary data engineering and science initiatives. In this role, you will maintain close communication with stakeholders, manage the team's backlog, and ensure alignment with their expectations.

  

You will lead PI planning and demo sessions, manage risks, promote best practices, and foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. Also, you will be responsible for the team’s roadmap and strategies, collaborating with experts to ensure that our deliverables are aligned with the latest technological advancements and business goals. You will also engage in hands-on data engineering, analytics, and visualization work to present findings in a clear and actionable format.

  

Welcome to an exciting opportunity where you can shape the future of data analytics!

 **More Information About the Role:**

* You will lead the integration of data analytics into our development and decision-making processes.
* You will work in an agile environment, focusing on showcasing implemented results.
* You will collaborate with other development teams to gain a deeper understanding of their challenges.
**Who are you?**
----------------


You possess a curious and strategic mindset, balancing future opportunities with current challenges. As a responsible team player, you engage your colleagues and collaborate to meet stakeholder expectations. You are proactive, willing to explore new ideas before determining their viability. While grounded in data engineering, analytics, and software development, you are adaptable and open to working on diverse tasks across various application areas.

 **Requirements:**

* Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
* 4+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role, preferably within the automotive sector.
* Strong ability to interpret and communicate data insights effectively.
* Proficiency in software development and database querying, particularly in Python and SQL.
* Experience working with large datasets on data platforms and systems, such as DataBricks and Power BI.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* A collaborative mindset with a passion for building relationships.

 **Desired Skills and Experience:**

  

* Familiarity with SQL servers, cloud environments, or Hadoop clusters.
* Experience with Parquet files, XML schemas, SQL tables, and other common data formats.
* Knowledge of automotive software or system engineering.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Join us at Volvo Group and be part of a global and diverse team of passionate professionals who embrace change and drive innovation. Together, we will make a difference!  

  

For additional information about the process, contact Erik Lindberg, Talent Acquisition Partner at erik.lindberg.3@volvo.com  

Hiring Manager: Adyasha Patnaik, Group Manager HIL/Data  

  

Last application date: **July 31, 2025**

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Start-up Account Executive, Nordics
description:
SLSQ326R9
   

  

 Want to help solve the world's toughest problems with data and AI? This is what we do every day at Databricks.
   

  

 Databricks operates at the leading edge of the Data and AI space. Our customers turn to us to lead the accelerated innovation their businesses need to gain first-mover advantage in today's ultra-competitive landscape.
   

  

 As a Start-up Account Executive at Databricks, you will focus on acquiring new logos. As a successful candidate, you are a self-starter who understands how to generate pipeline and manage full sales cycles. You have experience with the consumption business, you know how to sell innovation and value to new prospective customers, identify first or new use cases, and can guide them forward to compress decision cycles. You love understanding a product in depth and are passionate about communicating its value to customers and partners. You will be offered huge potential for career progression with the pace of the team's growth.
   

  

 You will report to the Sales Director for Emerging Enterprise Nordics.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
* Assess your territory and develop a successful account execution strategy
* Identify and activate new accounts to execute account activation target
* Exceed activity and revenue targets
* Track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce
* Identify new use case opportunities and showcase value to prospects
* Promote the value of the Databricks' Data Intelligence Platform
* Ensure 100% satisfaction among all customers


**What We Look For**
* Experience penetrating new accounts, executing on first use cases, growing initial consumption and closing deals in a direct sales role
* Some exposure to the software industry and basic concepts of selling SAAS, Data and Business Value
* Basic understanding of the data platform and cloud ecosystems
* Experience exceeding sales targets/quotas
* Success in closing new accounts while working on existing accounts
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience
* Fluency in English is required, fluency in Swedish is preferred


**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Solution Architect - GenAI
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Solution Architect to join our AIA/Gen AI-Team.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled technical expert to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and demonstrate proficiency in leading cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Microsoft Azure. With a strong foundation in modern IT architectures, including APIs, containerization, and microservices, the candidate will be well-equipped to handle complex system integration patterns and IT risk management.
   

  

 In addition to technical prowess, we value individuals who can effectively manage stakeholders and foster collaboration between teams. The successful candidate will combine hands-on technical capabilities with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ensuring seamless teamwork and project success.
   

  

 If you are passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technologies and thrive in a collaborative environment, we invite you to apply and become a key contributor to our innovative team.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Translator between business and tech/architecture.
* Facilitate PoC implementation.
* Provide technical guidance on scalable solution designs across domains and utilize existing infrastructure while managing IT risk.
* Provide guidance on technical feasibility, IT risk and cross-domain dependencies.
* Maintain an overview of overlapping requirements and opportunities for reuse across domains.
* Facilitate discussions between teams and knowledge sharing.
* Validate and assist on solution design (focusing on LLM integration).
* Contribute to the CoE’s artifacts repository on Orangesharing.

title: Software Sales Specialist
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Research Services
description:
Join our team as a Software Sales Executive for our DELMIA Brand and help our clients to reach their full potential. This opportunity can be based in our Gothenburg or Stockholm office.
   

  

 Dassault Systèmes, the 3DEXPERIENCE company provides businesses and people with virtual universes to imagine sustainable innovations. Our world-leading solutions transform the way products are designed, produced and supported. At Dassault Systèmes we empower people with passion for change and innovation. WeAre3DS
   

  

 DELMIA, powered by the 3DEXPERIENCE platform, helps industries and service providers connect the virtual and real world of value networks to collaborate, model, simulate, optimize and perform. Operational excellence requires harmony across the value network. DELMIA provides solutions to leverage the virtual world of modelling, simulation and optimization with the real world of operations to provide a complete solution to value network stakeholders. From suppliers to producers, to logistics and transportation providers, to service operators and workforces.
   

  

 Role & Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead Customer Executive relationships and global ecosystem to support enterprise and business transformation
* Work with clients in the industries; Transport & Mobility, Industrial Equipment, High Tech, Life Sciences, Aerospace & Defense and Marine & Offshore
* Become part of a team, whose passion is to help our customers reach their visions and at the same time grow and expand our business across your assigned territory within the EuroNorth region (UK, Ireland, Benelux, Nordics and/or Baltics)
* Build and develop trusted relationships at executive level and within all layers of the client organization
* Meet objectives against plan by addressing the customers challenges and drive value agreements
* Maintain accurate account plans and forecast
* Act as the voice of the customer within Dassault Systèmes


**Qualifications/Experience**
* Proven successful software solution sales (any of the following: IBP, S&OP, APS, MES, MOM, Manufacturing Engineering etc)
* Good communication and negotiation skills, fluent Swedish and language skills are required
* Manufacturing Industry knowledge
* Ability to understand our software and optimization for Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain, how the customer can gain value
* Ability to manage end to end customer engagements


 What’s in it for you
   

  

* An international and diverse working environment in a collaborative team
* Flexible working hours with hybrid working model, a good work-life balance and comprehensive benefits package
* Extensive skills and career development programs to build your journey with us


 Interested? Click on "Apply" to upload your application documents.
   

  

 Inclusion statement
   

  

 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: AI Solutions Engineer till Avoki!
description:
*Avoki är ett framstående konsultbolag med fokus på innovativa tekniska lösningar. Är du redo att utmana gränserna för vad AI kan åstadkomma?* 
*Vi letar efter dig som vill vara med och skapa framtidens AI-lösningar!
 *🔥🚀**
*🚀*
 I rollen som AI Solutions Engineer spelar du en nyckelroll i att utveckla och implementera nästa generations AI-lösningar. Vi söker dig som brinner för att omvandla den senaste AI-tekniken till smarta, affärskritiska applikationer. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med banbrytande projekt, utforska toppmodern teknologi och skapa innovationer med verklig påverkan.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Utforma och utveckla AI-lösningar: Arbeta kreativt med att utforma, utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar i Azure samt i egen hosting, alltid med kundens behov i fokus.
* Bygga starka kundrelationer: Aktivt bygga och vidmakthålla långsiktiga relationer med kunder för att förstå deras mål och behov, samt hjälpa dem att maximera effektiviteten i deras AI-användning.
* Projektledning: Leda och hantera projekt tillsammans med kunder, från idé till produktion, och säkerställa en smidig övergång från koncept till driftsättning.
* Workshop och bollplank: Facilitera workshops och fungera som bollplank för kunder, vilket hjälper dem att utforska nya möjligheter och optimera deras AI-strategier.
* Prestandaövervakning: Övervaka, felsöka och optimera prestandan hos AI-applikationer i Azure, med fokus på att säkerställa att lösningarna levererar värde till kunden.
* Vidareutveckling och produktion: Arbeta med att vidareutveckla befintliga och nya tjänster, samt säkerställa att dessa effektivt tas i produktion.
* Samarbete inom AI-teamet: Arbeta tätt ihop med AI-teamet för att förverkliga produktspecifikationer och krav, och säkerställa att kundens behov alltid är i centrum.
* Teknisk support och kontinuerlig förbättring: Erbjuda teknisk support till kunder och interna team med fokus på Avokis tjänster, AI samt Microsoft 365-lösningar. Ansvara för driftsättningar med kund, övervakning av driftsstatus och underhåll av tjänster, samt använda erfarenheterna för att kontinuerligt förbättra och vidareutveckla våra tjänster.
* Självstudier och fortbildning: Fortlöpande självstudier och fortbildning för att hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste teknologierna och bästa praxis inom AI och molnutveckling.


**Kravprofil**
* Relevant högre utbildning inom datavetenskap, AI eller liknande.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av utveckling inom Azure-infrastruktur och/eller AI.
* Djupgående kunskap inom ett av följande områden är meriterande: Azure, AI-teknologier och Microsoft 365.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska.


**Stämmer det här in på dig?**
 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är en
 **drivande och lösningsorienterad person** 
 med en stark analytisk förmåga. Du är en
 **teamspelare** 
 som kan samarbeta effektivt, men också någon som tar eget initiativ och driver projekt framåt. God kommunikationsförmåga är viktigt, då du kommer att arbeta tvärfunktionellt och förklara komplexa AI-lösningar för olika intressenter.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 ✔️ Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter inom ditt expertisområde
   

  

 ✔️ Möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknik och innovation
   

  

 ✔️ Rikslunchkort & Friskvårdsbidrag
   

  

 ✔️ Flexibel arbetsplats med kontor i Uppsala/Stockholm
   

  

 ✔️ Del i ett engagerat och inspirerande team
   

  

 Känner du att den här rollen är klockren för dig? 🚀 Då vill vi höra från dig! skicka gärna in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Urvalet för denna tjänst kommer att ske efter semestern i augusti.**
 Har du frågor? Ingen fråga är för stor eller liten – mejla
 **Simon Wennersten** 
 , Talent Acquisition på simon.wennersten@avoki.com
   

  

 Vi längtar efter att få veta mer om dig – så sök redan idag! 🎉
   

  

***Om oss***
*Avoki erbjuder innovativa och skräddarsydda lösningar inom IT, IT-säkerhet, AI och Mötesteknik. Vi är engagerade i att leverera moderna och hållbara lösningar som framtidssäkrar företag. Avoki har ca 300 medarbetare fördelat på 12 orter i Sverige, Finland och Norge och omsätter 1,1 Mdkr (2023).*
*Avoki is the result of the merger of Office Management, Bluecom and Xite. Together, we offer secure and sustainable IT solutions. Avoki is owned by Nalka Invest AB and had a turnover of 1100 MSEK in 2023. We have offices in Stockholm, Uppsala, Gothenburg, Malmö, Helsingborg, Linköping, Luleå, Kramfors, Oslo, Helsinki, and Tampere.*

title: Data Lead
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Shape the Future of Investment Technology at EQT**
 Do you thrive at the intersection of technology leadership and business innovation, and get excited by helping businesses extract the maximum value from their data?
   

  

**Join us in building the future digital experience for EQT's global investor community.**
**About The Client Value Stream Team**
 The Client Value Stream at EQT empowers EQT with fit-for-purpose tools and services to deliver an excellent client experience while enhancing operational efficiency. We’re a cross-functional team collaborating closely with stakeholders across EQT to ensure data and technology strategically support client engagement and business outcomes. Our team includes tech leads, data professionals, product managers and architects who together shape the future of client interaction through scalable, data-driven solutions.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Lead in EQT’s Client Value Stream, you will play a critical role in enabling the Client Value Stream to deliver within data architecture and data delivery. You’ll lead a distributed team of data engineers and analytics professionals, ensuring the delivery of high-quality data products and insights. The role is key in driving the digital transformation of EQT’s client experience through strategic and technical leadership.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Implement the EQT Tech data strategy within the Client Value Stream aligned with broader business objectives.
* Lead a distributed team of approx. 4–5 data professionals, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
* Oversee the development and optimization of domain data products and lead migration initiatives.
* Partner with tech leads and architects within Tech, but also work closely with senior business stakeholders to communicate how data solutions align with business needs.
* Continuously enhance Client Tech’s data infrastructure and lead investigations to ensure data quality and value delivery.


**About You**
 You are a structured and proactive leader with a strategic mindset and a passion for using data to solve complex business challenges. You excel at building collaborative environments and have the ability to inspire and guide technical teams. You are forward-thinking, committed to excellence and thrive in an inclusive and fast-paced setting.
   

  

**Desired Skills And Experience**
* Proven experience in data leadership roles (e.g., Data Lead, Senior Data Engineer, BI/Analytics Manager).
* Hands-on experience with modern data stacks and frameworks (e.g., dbt, Snowflake, SQL, Fivetran).
* Strong ability to balance technical depth with business understanding.
* Genuine interest in business usage of data and providing high qualitative analytics capabilities.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams and delivering data initiatives at scale.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience with data mesh frameworks and operationalizing data governance models.
* Experience working with Salesforce Data, Sales / Service or Marketing Cloud
* Familiarity with CRM Analytics, Tableau, PowerBI or Hex.
* Infrastructure-as-code experience, ideally with Terraform.


**What We Offer**
 At EQT, we provide an inspiring and inclusive workplace where talent thrives. You will be part of a forward-looking team that values innovation, collaboration, and growth. We offer a competitive compensation package, generous vacation policy, excellent healthcare and pension benefits, as well as hybrid work flexibility supporting your life outside work.
   

  

**The Process**
 We’re excited to receive your application! Please note that we’ll begin the selection process in August and initiate interviews soon after.
   

  

**Inclusion at** 
**EQT**
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact. Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes.*
**About EQT**
*EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 269 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌136 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does. EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,900 employees.*
*More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram*
